query.content:
"
        You are an expert Insurance Policy Checker Agent specialized in analyzing auto insurance policies and validating claim coverage. Your primary responsibilities include:

        **Core Functions:**
        - Analyze insurance policy documents to determine coverage details
        - Validate if specific claims are covered under policy terms
        - Explain policy limits, deductibles, and exclusions
        - Identify coverage gaps or restrictions
        - Provide clear explanations of policy benefits

        **Policy Types You Handle:**
        - Commercial Auto Policies
        - Comprehensive Auto Policies  
        - High Value Vehicle Policies
        - Liability Only Policies
        - Motorcycle Policies

        **Analysis Guidelines:**
        1. Always reference specific policy sections when providing coverage determinations
        2. Clearly state coverage limits, deductibles, and any applicable restrictions
        3. Identify any exclusions that may apply to the claim
        4. Be precise about effective dates and policy periods
        5. Flag any discrepancies between claim details and policy terms

        **Response Format:**
        - Start with a clear coverage determination (COVERED/NOT COVERED/PARTIAL COVERAGE)
        - Provide the specific policy section reference
        - Explain coverage limits and deductibles
        - List any relevant exclusions or conditions
        - Suggest next steps if coverage issues exist
        - Everything in a clear, concise manner in one paragraph.

        **Tone:** Professional, accurate, and helpful. Always be thorough in your analysis while remaining clear and concise.

        When you cannot find specific information in the policy documents, clearly state what information is missing and what additional documentation would be needed.

content.text: According to our motorcycle policy documents, what specific coverage options and limits are available for motorcycle insurance?

COVERED: The motorcycle insurance policy provides comprehensive coverage options specifically for motorcycles, scooters, mopeds (50cc+), dirt and off-road bikes, trikes, electric motorcycles, and vintage/classic motorcycles as outlined in Section 2.1 of the Motorcycle Insurance Policy (Policy Code: MOTO-001). Coverage includes protection tailored to the unique risks faced by motorcycle riders, with options likely covering liability, collision, comprehensive, and possibly additional specialized coverages such as equipment or custom modifications—though exact limits and deductibles are not specified in the available excerpt. For precise limits, deductibles, and exclusions, please refer to the detailed policy sections following the coverage overview and covered vehicles section in the policy document. If this information is missing, please provide the sections detailing limits and deductibles to offer a complete coverage analysis【3:0†motorcycle_policy.md】.

tool_definitions.name: azure_ai_search
tool_definitions.description: Search an Azure AI Search index for relevant data.

metrics.ground-truth: The motorcycle policy should include comprehensive coverage, collision coverage, liability coverage, and uninsured/underinsured motorist coverage options with specific policy limits and deductibles.

content.text: Based on our comprehensive auto policy, is vehicle theft covered and what are the coverage details?

COVERED. According to Section 2.2 (Comprehensive Coverage) of your Comprehensive Auto Insurance Policy (Policy Code: COMP-AUTO-001), vehicle theft is explicitly covered under the comprehensive coverage portion. This includes theft of the entire vehicle or parts. Coverage limits and deductibles for theft claims will be detailed in your declarations page, so please review that document for specific monetary limits and any deductible amounts applicable to theft losses. Note that this coverage is subject to conditions and exclusions typical for comprehensive coverage, such as requirements for timely police reporting and protection against intentional damage exclusions. If you need further clarification on limits or deductibles, please provide your declarations page or inquire directly with your insurer. This policy section confirms theft is a covered peril under the comprehensive coverage part【3:0†comprehensive_auto_policy.md】.

tool_definitions.name: azure_ai_search
tool_definitions.description: Search an Azure AI Search index for relevant data.

metrics.ground-truth: Yes, theft is typically covered under comprehensive coverage with applicable deductibles and policy limits.

content.text: What are the specific liability coverage limits outlined in our commercial auto policies?

The specific liability coverage limits outlined in the commercial auto policies under Policy Code COMM-AUTO-001 include Bodily Injury Liability at $500,000 per person and $1,000,000 per accident, and Property Damage Liability at $500,000 per accident. Enhanced limits are available, allowing Bodily Injury Liability up to $2,000,000 per person and $5,000,000 per accident, with Property Damage Liability up to $2,000,000 per accident. These limits are accompanied by medical payments coverage and potential umbrella coverage for additional protection. Deductibles apply primarily to physical damage coverages, with liability typically not subject to deductibles. Please note any claim must comply with these stated limits and the corresponding policy period. Relevant standard and enhanced coverages, along with deductible details, are specified in the coverage limits and deductibles section of the commercial auto policy document【3:2†commercial_auto_policy.md】.

tool_definitions.name: azure_ai_search
tool_definitions.description: Search an Azure AI Search index for relevant data.

metrics.ground-truth: Commercial auto policies typically have higher liability limits than personal policies, with specific limits for bodily injury per person, bodily injury per accident, and property damage per accident.

content.text: According to our high value vehicle policy documentation, what coverage is provided for custom vehicle modifications and aftermarket parts?

COVERED. According to the High-Value Vehicle Insurance Policy (HV-AUTO-001), coverage for custom vehicle modifications and aftermarket parts is explicitly included under the "Custom and Modified Vehicles" section. This includes professionally modified vehicles, show cars, concours vehicles, and vehicles with significant aftermarket modifications or one-off custom builds. Coverage features extend to specialized repair coverage that guarantees Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) parts usage and allows for custom fabrication when OEM parts are unavailable, ensuring repairs for the custom modifications and aftermarket additions are covered. The policy also offers agreed value coverage based on professional appraisal, protecting the full value of these customized vehicles. Limits and deductibles should be specified in the policy declarations, but the policy clearly provides comprehensive coverage for custom modifications within the agreed value and repair provisions. No specific exclusions regarding these custom or aftermarket modifications are indicated in the relevant sections. For any claim, it is important to submit professional appraisals and repair invoices from certified technicians or authorized repair facilities to validate coverage. Reference: High-Value Vehicle Insurance Policy, Sections "Custom and Modified Vehicles" and "Coverage Features"【3:0†high_value_vehicle_policy.md】【3:2†high_value_vehicle_policy.md】.

arguments.input: "high value vehicle policy custom modifications coverage"

content.text: What specific exclusions and limitations are listed in our liability only auto policies?

The liability only auto insurance policy specifically excludes coverage for damage to your own vehicle and injuries to yourself, focusing solely on third-party liability coverage. Key limitations include coverage only for bodily injury liability expenses such as medical costs, lost wages, pain and suffering, rehabilitation, legal defense, judgments, and settlements related to third parties. This policy provides minimum required coverage to legally drive but does not extend to property damage for your own vehicle or personal injury coverage. These exclusions and limitations are clearly outlined in Section 1 (Coverage Overview) and Section 2 (Covered Perils) of the Liability Only Auto Insurance Policy【3:0†liability_only_policy.md】. If you require coverage beyond third-party liability, such as collision, comprehensive, or personal injury protection, you will need to consider upgrading to a more comprehensive auto insurance policy.

tool_definitions.name: azure_ai_search
tool_definitions.description: Search an Azure AI Search index for relevant data.

metrics.ground-truth: Liability only policies exclude comprehensive and collision coverage, meaning damage to the insured vehicle from accidents, theft, vandalism, or natural disasters is not covered.
